scoped.description: If true, auth is scoped to the specific claims rather than granting broad access permissions;

AccountPermissions.description: Set of flags for account permissions

ExecutionInfo.description: Information about a symbol related to its execution route.

exchange_symbol.description: If the execution venue has stable symbology, this may be populated

oneOf.title: Varying
oneOf.description:
List of (threshold, tick_size) pairs.  For price greater than or equal to each threshold, the tick size is the corresponding value.

For example, if the thresholds are [(100, 0.01), (200, 0.02)], valid prices include:

...199.98, 199.99, 200.00, 200.02, 200.04...

OptionsSeriesInstance.description: A specific option from a series.

eps_adj.description: For stocks, adjusted earnings per share

short_description.description: Short description of the product, suitable for display in a bubble, for example

quantity.description: Some spreads have different ratios for their legs, like buy 1 A, sell 2 B, buy 1 C; We would represent that with quantities in the legs: 1, -2, 1

a.title: asks
a.description: Set of (price, level) updates. If zero, the price level has been removed from the book.

b.title: bids
b.description: Set of (price, level) updates. If zero, the price level has been removed from the book.

Dir.description: An order side/direction or a trade execution side/direction. In GraphQL these are serialized as "buy" or "sell".

nid.title: new_order_id
nid.description: The new order ID that will be assigned to the order after modification.

ats.title: recv_time
ats.description: When Architect received the fill, if realtime

fu.title: fee_currency
fu.description: Fee currency, if different from the price currency

ts.title: trade_time
ts.description: When the cpty claims the trade happened

AberrantFill.description: Fills which we received but couldn't parse fully, return details best effort

cost_basis.description: Cost basis of the position, if known.

trade_time.description: NB: the meaning of this field varies by reporting venue

unrealized_pnl.description: Unrealized PNL of the position, if known.

equity.description: Total account equity; net liquidation value.

position_margin.description: Margin requirement based on current positions only.

purchasing_power.description: Total purchasing power; post-multiplied. (e.g. for cash margin account could be 2x available cash)

total_margin.description: Margin requirement calculated for worst-case based on open positions and working orders.

last_heartbeat.description: UNIX epoch time or -1 for never

last_heartbeat_stale_threshold.description: Stale threshold in seconds, or -1 for never stale

logged_in.description: Not applicable to connection if None

BracketParams.description:
A bracket order consists of an entry limit order, a take-profit order, and a stop-loss order.

The take-profit and stop-loss orders are managed via a One-Cancels-Other (OCO) algo as a subalgo.

# Note

You cannot modify the algo once it is sent, you must cancel and send a new one if you want different parameters.

trigger_in_proportion.description: if true, the OCO exit orders will be sent proportionally to the filled quantity of the entry order

chase_ticks.description: number of ticks more aggressive than the desired price for taking orders this is just to greatly increase the likelihood of a fill

price_multiplier.description: for calculation of the spread: price + price_offset is multiplied by this

price_offset.description: for calculation of the spread: offset is applied pre-multiplier

quantity_ratio.description: the amount to fire on per unit of spread Note that fractional units can be given, but quantities will be rounded down Or will be rounded up a leg is behind where it should be relative to spread count

quoting_parameters.description: Quoting parameters - if None, the leg doesn't quote

MissedTakePolicy.description: Policy for handling missed hedge orders that don't get filled within the specified duration

OneCancelsOtherParams.description:
An OCO order consists of multiple orders where the fill of any one order automatically cancels all other orders in the group.

# Cancellation Behavior

- All orders are placed simultaneously when the algo starts - When any order is fully filled, the remaining orders are immediately cancelled - If `cancel_in_proportion` is true, partial fills trigger proportional cancellations of the remaining orders based on the fill quantity. Cancelled orders are replaced with new orders of proportionally-reduced quantities, rounded according to the instrument's step size. - If `cancel_in_proportion` is false, only a complete fill of one order triggers cancellation of all other orders - Cancelled orders are replaced with new orders (in proportional mode) to maintain exposure while accounting for partial fills on other orders

# Proportional Mode Details

When `cancel_in_proportion` is true: - Each fill (partial or complete) triggers cancellation of all other active orders - Cancelled orders are replaced with new orders calculated as: `new_quantity = original_quantity * (1 - percent_filled_on_any_order)` - The replacement quantity is rounded according to each instrument's step size - This ensures that as one order fills, the other orders proportionally reduce in size

# Use Cases

Common use cases include: - Placing orders on multiple exchanges where you only want one to execute - Implementing profit target and stop loss orders simultaneously - Managing risk by ensuring only one side of a position is filled - Spreading orders across venues while maintaining proportional exposure

# Important Notes

- You cannot modify the algo once it is sent; you must cancel and send a new one if you want different parameters - You also cannot pause the algo; it will simply stop if a pause is sent - If an order is rejected, the algo will continue operating with the remaining orders - The progress is based on the percentage of any order filled relative to its original quantity - It is technically possible for all orders to be filled if they execute simultaneously

OneTriggersOtherParams.description:
An OTO order consists of a primary "primary" order and one or more "secondary" orders that are triggered only after the primary order is filled.

# Triggering Behavior

- The "primary" order is placed immediately when the algo starts - The "secondary" orders are only placed after the primary order is filled - If `trigger_in_proportion` is true, the secondary orders are triggered proportionally rounded down based on the fill quantity of the primary order. A given leg might have multiple orders triggered in this way if the primary order is filled in multiple fills. - If `trigger_in_proportion` is false, the secondary orders are only triggered after the primary order is completely filled - This algo will not attempt to re-send any orders that are manually cancelled - This algo never cancels any orders, and any manual cancellations will not be re-sent.

# Use Cases

Common use cases include: - Executing a hedging strategy after an initial position is established - Implementing conditional order sequences where subsequent orders depend on initial fills

# Note

You cannot modify the algo once it is sent, you must cancel and send a new one if you want different parameters. If you manually cancel any of the orders, or they get rejected, the algo will NOT send the order again. The progress in the status is based on the primary order filled amount only.

secondary_fills.description: Each entry corresponds to the fills for the respective secondary order

po.title: post_only
po.description: note that the CME does not support post-only

improve_by.description: If specified, improve the market by the specified number of ticks otherwise, join the current best price

limit_price.description: the most aggressive price the algo will quote at

max_quote_quantity.description: Maximum quantity to quote at a time

max_ticks_outside.description: Maximum number of ticks less aggressive than the BBO to quote - `None`: No constraint on distance from BBO - will quote at any valid price up to the limit price - `Some(n)`: Will only quote if within n ticks of the best same-side price (BBO) Orders beyond this distance are cancelled as they're unlikely to fill - Example: With `Some(5)` for a buy order, if best bid is 100, will only quote between 95-100

post_only.description: By default, QuoteOneSide avoids marketable orders. Set to false with improve_by > 0 to allow the algo to potentially cross the market when improving.

quantity_filled.description: Used to track existing fill quantity when modifying quote. Ignore for most use cases.

ticks_before_repricing.description: optionally specify how many ticks away the market has to move before updating an existing quote.

time_before_repricing.description: optionally specify how long to wait before updating an existing quote

QuoteOneSideStatus.description: Current status of the QuoteOneSide algorithm

front_of_queue.description: Indicates whether the current quote is at the front of the queue (best price on our side) - For Buy orders: `true` when our quote price > previous best bid on the market - For Sell orders: `true` when our quote price < previous best ask on the market - Also `true` when we're the first to establish a quote on our side (no existing bid/ask) - This status updates dynamically as market conditions change and other orders arrive/cancel - Being front of queue provides priority for fills

is_cancelling.description: Indicates whether the algorithm is currently cancelling an order

improve_by.description: If specified, improve the market by the specified number of ticks otherwise, join the current best price

max_quote_quantity.description: Maximum quantity to quote at a time

max_ticks_outside.description: Maximum number of ticks less aggressive than the BBO to quote

ticks_before_repricing.description: optionally specify how many ticks away the market has to move before updating an existing quote.

time_before_repricing.description: optionally specify how long to wait before updating an existing quote

missed_hedge_policy.description: Policy for handling missed hedge orders that don't get filled within the specified duration

missed_hedge_wait_time.description: a string representing time, for example "5s", "1m", "2h"

TakingParameters.description: For when each leg is taking (ie not a quote order)

max_fire_quantity.description: max fire quantity for a single fire

min_quantity_threshold.description: min quantity needed on the spread quantity for the spread before firing unless the remaining spread quantity to do is below this threshold

take_lockout.description: time lockout before another spread-taking order again
